citation.article-title: Mesorhizobium camelthorni sp. nov., isolated from Alhagi sparsifolia
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Mesorhizobium camelthorni sp. nov.

Mesorhizobium camelthorni (ca.mel.thor′ni. N.L. n. camelthornum camelthorn, a common name for leguminous plants of the genus Alhagi in China; N.L. gen. n. camelthorni of camelthorn, from which the type strain was isolated).
Gram-negative, aerobic, motile, non-spore-forming rods, 0.3–0.6 μm wide by 1.0–1.2 μm long.
Colonies on yeast extract-malt extract agar (YMA) are white, opaque, circular and convex with diameter of 1–2 mm within 5–7 days at 28 °C; generation time ranges from 4.8 to 6.6 h.
The optimum temperature and pH for growth are 28 °C and pH 7.
Unable to grow on YMA at pH 5.0 or pH 12.0 or at 10 °C.
Utilizes sodium citrate, l-rhamnose, d-xylose, d-fructose, d-sorbitol, d-arabinose, inositol and sodium succinate, but not sodium hippurate, dl-histidine, melibiose, sodium tartrate or d-arginine.
Unable to grow on YMA supplemented with methylene blue, malachite green, methyl green or methyl red.
Sensitive to streptomycin, gentamicin sulfate and amikacin sulfate, but tolerant to erythromycin and gentamicin (all at 5 μg ml−1).
Able to grow on YMA in the presence of 2 % (w/v) NaCl.
The DNA G+C content is 59.5–63.7 mol%.

Can be differentiated clearly from other species of the genus Mesorhizobium by both genetic and phenotypic methods, including sequences of core genes (16S rRNA, recA and glnA), fatty acid composition and levels of DNA–DNA relatedness.
The type strain, CCNWXJ 40-4T (=HAMBI 3020T =ACCC 14549T), was isolated from a root nodule of A. sparsifolia in Alaer, Xinjiang Province, China.
The DNA G+C content of strain CCNWXJ 40-4T is 63.7 mol%.
